precedents.title: Makoko Floating School
precedents.description: A prototype floating structure, built for the Makoko waterfront community in Lagos, Nigeria. The school was designed to address the community's social and physical needs in the context of climate change and rapid urbanization.

precedents.title: Lideta Mercato
precedents.description: A shopping mall in Addis Ababa that uses a perforated concrete facade inspired by traditional Ethiopian fractal patterns. The facade provides passive ventilation and shading, reducing energy consumption.

precedents.title: Red Location Museum
precedents.description: A museum in Port Elizabeth dedicated to the history of the anti-apartheid struggle. The design uses industrial materials like corrugated steel and exposed structure to evoke the memory of the surrounding informal settlement.

precedents.title: Primary School Gando
precedents.description: A primary school in Burkina Faso built with locally sourced clay and traditional construction techniques, augmented with modern engineering. The design features a large, elevated roof that provides shade and promotes natural ventilation.
